Generic Waveform Generator¶

class fastlisaresponse.response.pyResponseTDI(sampling_frequency, num_pts, orbit_kwargs, order=25, tdi='1st generation', tdi_orbit_kwargs={}, tdi_chan='XYZ', use_gpu=False, t0=100.0)¶

Bases: object

Class container for fast LISA response function generation.

# TODO: fill in

Parameters

  • sampling_frequency (double) – The sampling rate in Hz.

  • num_pts (int) – Number of points to produce for the final output template.

  • orbit_kwargs (dict) – Dictionary containing orbital information. The kwargs and defaults are: orbit_module=None, order=0, max_t_orbits=3.15576e7, orbit_file=None. orbit_module is an orbit module from the LDC package. max_t_orbits is the maximum time desired for the orbital information. orbit_file is an h5 file of the form used here. order is the order of interpolation used in the orbit modules.

  • order (int, optional) – Order of Lagrangian interpolation technique. Lower orders will be faster. The user must make sure the order is sufficient for the waveform being used. (default: 25)

  • tdi (str or list, optional) – TDI setup. Currently, the stock options are '1st generation' and '2nd generation'. Or the user can provide a list of tdi_combinations of the form {"link": 12, "links_for_delay": [21, 13, 31], "sign": 1}. 'link' (int) the link index (12, 21, 13, 31, 23, 32) for the projection (\(y_{gw}\)). 'links_for_delay' (list) are the link indexes as a list with which delays are applied. ‘sign’ is the sign in front of the contribution to the TDI observable. It takes the value of 1 or -1. (default: ‘1st generation’)
